intro: Neololeba hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy neololeba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Neololeba hirsuta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream sides.
